documentation.text:
@title SafeMath
 @dev Math operations with safety checks that throw on error

@dev The Ownable constructor sets the original `owner` of the contract to the sender
 account.
@dev Throws if called by any account other than the owner.

@dev Allows the current owner to transfer control of the contract to a newOwner.
 @param newOwner The address to transfer ownership to.

@title ERC20 interface
 @dev see https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/20

@title Basic token
 @dev Basic version of StandardToken, with no allowances.
@dev Fix for the ERC20 short address attack.

@title Pausable
 @dev Base contract which allows children to implement an emergency stop mechanism.
@dev Modifier to make a function callable only when the contract is not paused.
@dev Modifier to make a function callable only when the contract is paused.
@dev called by the owner to pause, triggers stopped state
@dev called by the owner to unpause, returns to normal state

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Cannot issue more than the supply"

arguments.value: Cannot issue more than the supply

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Cannot issue more than the supply"

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Must not issue more than the owner"

arguments.value: Must not issue more than the owner

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Must not issue more than the owner"

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Cannot redeem more than the total supply"

arguments.value: Cannot redeem more than the total supply

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Cannot redeem more than the total supply"

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Cannot issue more than the owner has"

arguments.value: Cannot issue more than the owner has

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Cannot issue more than the owner has"

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "max fees must be be less than 50"

arguments.value: max fees must be be less than 50

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "max fees must be be less than 50"
